revision.comment: Replacing dead link with new cite danas template.
revision.text:
{{Infobox military unit |unit_name=Attack Squadron 135 |image= |caption= |dates= 1 March 1944 - 30 November 1949 |country= [[United States]] |allegiance= |branch= [[United States Navy]] |type= Attack |role= |size= |command_structure= |current_commander= |garrison= |nickname=Uninvited |motto= |colors= |colors_label= |mascot= |battles=[[World War II]] |aircraft_attack=[[Grumman TBF Avenger|TBF/M Avenger]]
[[Douglas A-1 Skyraider|AD-4 Skyraider]] |anniversaries= }} '''VA-135''' was an '''Attack Squadron''' of the [[U.S. Navy]], nicknamed ''Uninvited''. It was established as '''Torpedo Squadron VT-81''' on 1 March 1944, redesignated '''VA-14A''' on 15 November 1946, and finally designated '''VA-135''' on 2 August 1948. The squadron was disestablished on 30 November 1949. A [[Second VA-135 (U.S. Navy)|second squadron]] bore the '''VA-135''' designation in 1961-1962; the squadrons were not related.{{cite DANAS |volume=1 |article=VA-135 |page=203 |section=va125153}} ==Operational history== [[File:USS Princeton (CV-37) Tsingtao 1948.jpg|thumb|right|250px|{{USS|Princeton|CV-37|6}} at anchor in [[Tsingtao, China]] in 1948. Her airgroup included only [[Grumman F8F Bearcat|F8F-1]] Bearcats ([[VF-21|VF-131]] and [[VF-132]]) and [[Grumman TBF Avenger|TBM-3E/-3Q]] Avengers ([[VA-15 (U.S. Navy)|VA-15]] and VA-135)]] *14 November 1944: The squadron’s first combat strike was conducted against [[Manila]] Harbor. *9–20 January 1945: The squadron was part of a task force that entered the [[South China Sea]] and conducted combat operations against [[Cam Ranh Bay]]; [[Hong Kong]] and [[Kaohsiung|Takao Harbor]], [[Formosa]]. *16 February 1945: The squadron struck the home islands of [[Japan]], flying a seven-plane attack against Hamamatuo Airfield on [[Honshu]]. *21 February 1945: The squadron participated in its first ground support mission, flying sorties over [[Battle of Iwo Jima|Iwo Jima]]. *1 March 1945: The squadron flew its last combat strike of the war. During the four months of combat operations from {{USS|Wasp|CV-18|6}} it did not lose any personnel due to enemy action (two personnel were lost due to operational accidents). *15–29 June 1946: The squadron embarked on {{USS|Princeton|CV-37|6}} and transited from Norfolk to San Diego via the [[Panama Canal]]. ==Home port assignments== The squadron was assigned to these home ports, effective on the dates shown: * [[NAS Quonset Point]] – 01 Mar 1944 * [[NAAF Martha's Vineyard]] – 01 Mar 1944* * [[NAAF Boca Chica]] – 20 Apr 1944* * [[NAAF Otis Field]] – 10 May 1944* * [[NAS San Diego]] – 10 Aug 1944* * [[NAS Puunene]] – 01 Sep 1944* * [[NAS Pasco]] – 13 May 1945* * [[NAAF Sanford]] – 31 Jul 1945* * [[NAS Quonset Point]] – 15 Sep 1945 * [[NAS San Diego]] – Jun 1946 * [[NAS Jacksonville]] – 01 Apr 1949 * Temporary shore assignment while the squadron conducted training in preparation for combat deployment. ==Aircraft Assignment== The squadron first received the following aircraft on the dates shown: * [[Grumman TBF Avenger|TBF-1C ''Avenger'']] – Mar 1944 * [[Grumman TBF Avenger|TBM-1 ''Avenger'']] – Mar 1944 * [[Grumman TBF Avenger|TBF-1 ''Avenger'']] – Mar 1944 * [[Grumman TBF Avenger|TBF-1C ''Avenger'']] – Nov 1944 * [[Grumman TBF Avenger|TBM-1D ''Avenger'']] – Nov 1944 * [[Grumman TBF Avenger|TBM-3 ''Avenger'']] – May 1945 * [[Grumman TBF Avenger|TBM-3E ''Avenger'']] – May 1945 * [[Grumman TBF Avenger|TBM-3Q ''Avenger'']] – 1946 * [[Douglas A-1 Skyraider|AD-4 ''Skyraider'']] – Sep 1949 ==See also== {{Wikipedia books|United States Navy Aircraft Squadrons}} * [[Second VA-135 (U.S. Navy)]] * [[Attack aircraft]] * [[List of inactive United States Navy aircraft squadrons]] * [[History of the United States Navy]] ==References== {{DANAS}} {{reflist}} ==External links== Dictionary of American Naval Aviation Squadrons]]
